summary: This DOJ OIG memorandum details the analysis of surveillance video footage from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 9-10, 2019, surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It documents the limited camera coverage, identifies staff on duty, and reconstructs a timeline of events, revealing that correctional officers failed to conduct required inmate counts and rounds. This document is a detailed timeline analysis of surveillance camera footage from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. It meticulously tracks the movements of correctional officers (COs) and inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, in the hours leading up to his death. The report cross-references footage with officer statements and official logs.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call and Return to Cell
events.description: Unit Manager escorted Epstein to the SHU shower cell on G tier for a legal phone call at approximately 6:53 p.m. Epstein was later escorted back to his cell on L tier at approximately 7:49 p.m.

events.title: Failure to Conduct 10 p.m. Count
events.description: Video review shows Correctional Officer Tova Noel walked the SHU tiers alone between 10:30 p.m. and 10:36 p.m., which the OIG interprets as a round, not the required two-officer count. The 10 p.m. count sheet was marked as received by Control Officer.

events.title: No Rounds Conducted from 12 a.m. to 6 a.m.
events.description: Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and did not conduct any of the required counts or rounds during their shift from 12:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m. Video confirms no movement into SHU tiers.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Noel opened the L tier gate for Thomas to conduct feeding. Thomas told Noel that Epstein had hung himself. Noel activated her body alarm at approximately 6:33 a.m.

events.title: Epstein Moved from G Tier to L Tier Cell
events.description: At 19:49, a CO escorted Epstein from G tier across the SHU floor and up to L tier, returning him to his cell.

events.title: Noel Delivers Meal to Epstein
events.description: At approximately 20:39, Noel (carrying a food tray) and another CO walked up to L tier, consistent with her statement that she provided Epstein with his meal after he was returned to his cell.

events.title: Shift Change and Increased Activity at L Tier
events.description: Beginning around 6:30 a.m., multiple COs are seen moving hurriedly between L tier (Epstein's cell tier), the desk area, and the entrance, indicating the discovery of an incident.

events.title: Scheduled Counts in SHU
events.description: The document notes multiple scheduled counts (10 p.m., 3 a.m., 5 a.m.) performed by officers including Noel, which are cross-referenced with camera footage and official logs.

keyFacts: Only one surveillance camera inside the SHU was recording on August 9-10, 2019; it was of low quality and provided only a partial view of the common area and some stairways.

Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to falsifying official records by prefilling count and round sheets for the early morning of August 10, 2019, and not performing the required checks.
Video evidence indicates the last time a correctional officer entered the L tier (where Epstein's cell was) prior to 6 a.m. on August 10 was at 10:39 p.m. on August 9.
The OIG's investigation revealed a systemic failure in protocol, including the 10 p.m. count on August 9 not being properly conducted by two officers as required.
The document is part of the OIG's investigation into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in federal custody.
The document provides a minute-by-minute reconstruction of officer and inmate movement in the MCC SHU on the night of August 9-10, 2019, based on surveillance footage.
Jeffrey Epstein was escorted from G tier back to his cell on L tier at 7:49 p.m. on August 9, and a meal was delivered to his cell tier around 8:39 p.m.
Correctional Officer Noel's actions, such as meal delivery and performing counts, are explicitly corroborated by her statements to the OIG given through her attorney, Jason Foy.
A significant increase in hurried movement by multiple officers around L tier begins at approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, coinciding with the time Epstein was found unresponsive.
The report is part of an official investigation (Case Number: 2019009707) and includes references to attached documents like FBI video analysis, prison rosters, and count sheets.
